title: Insecure Plugin Design
description: Insecure plugin design occurs when plugins or tools integrated with the LLM have security vulnerabilities. This includes plugins that execute arbitrary code, have excessive permissions, lack input validation, or can be exploited to perform unauthorized actions.

mitigations.implementation: Use sandboxing, implement least privilege, validate all plugin inputs, and restrict plugin capabilities to minimum required.
Implement plugin authentication, use allowlists for approved plugins, and verify plugin integrity before execution.
Implement strict input validation, sanitization, and type checking for all plugin inputs and outputs.
Use containerization or sandboxing to isolate plugin execution and prevent access to unauthorized resources.

references.title: OWASP LLM Top 10 - LLM07: Insecure Plugin Design
